commentBody: Massachusetts is a first generation rust belt state.  The textile manufacturing that served as the backbone for its economy was largely relocated to the south during the 60s and 70s and finally completely disappeared off-shore.  So older blue-color workers will certainly support Trump.  Also, don't forget about South Boston and the racial anxieties of the white underclass.  All of these factors point to a strong showing by Trump across Ohio, Michigan, and Pennsylvannia.

replies.commentBody:
Just a comment about south Boston then and South Boston now.

I suggest you look at typical real estate prices in this neighborhood. The only people who can afford to live there in this day and age are people making a lot of money - it has been and continues to be highly gentrified. It will be a mostly liberal neighborhood going forward.

Most people now living there know about the racial hostility there only as a historical moment.
